docs.snippet: Plans for extending foreign--exchange credits to Chile with which to meet the service requirements on that country's foreign indebtedness in the remainder of the year were under active discussion by leading Wall Street bankers yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Plans for extending foreign--exchange credits to Chile with which to meet the service requirements on that country's foreign indebtedness in the remainder of the year were under active discussion by leading Wall Street bankers yesterday.

headline.main: AID SEEN FOR CHILE FOR DEBT SERVICE; Foreign Exchange Credits Are Discussed by Bankers Here --$20,000,000 to Be Met. GOLD SHIPMENTS UNLIKELY Action by Federal Reserve Doubted Except in Indirect Assistance-- Conference Reported Off. Federal Reserve Credit Doubted. Financial Conference Unlikely. $20,000,000 to Be Met.

docs.snippet: Record-breaking releases of gold held under earmark here for foreign account, together with shipments through New York and San Francisco, resulted in the last month in ...

headline.main: GAIN IN GOLD HERE LARGEST SINCE WAR; Releases From Earmarking in June Send Holdings to New Record. GERMAN DEALS REFLECTED Receipts In First Six Months of Year Are More Than Twice Those in 1930 Period. Large Imports; Small Exports. Gold Movement in Six Months. LITTLE EFFECT IN GOLD GAIN. Money Conditions and Banking Credit Unchanged.

SHIPPING AND MAILS; Steamships Arrived Yesterday Incoming Passenger and Mail Steamships. Outgoing Passenger and Mail Steamships. Outgoing Freight Steamships Carrying No Mail Foreign Ports--Arrivals and Debartures Panama Canal Transatlantic Mails Due at New York Transpacific Mails From New York

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, July 1.--Uruguay's export trade for the first six months of this year totaled 46,000,000 pesos [$27,600,000 by today's exchange] and her imports ran to 43,500,000 pesos [$25,100,000], leaving a favorable balance of $2,500,000.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, July 1.--Uruguay's export trade for the first six months of this year totaled 46,000,000 pesos [$27,600,000 by today's exchange] and her imports ran to 43,500,000 pesos [$25,100,000], leaving a favorable balance of $2,500,000.

headline.main: BALANCE FAVORS URUGUAY.; Exports for Half Year Total $27,600,000. Imports Are $25,100,000.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 1.-- Wood gas as a substitute for gasoline has had a trial of a month on an omnibus in this city.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 1.-- Wood gas as a substitute for gasoline has had a trial of a month on an omnibus in this city.
docs.abstract: Wood gas tried as substitute for gasoline

headline.main: WOOD GAS DRIVES A BUS.; Montevideo Company Says it Has Cheap Substitute for Gasoline.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Harry L. Reichenbach, press agent for motion picture stars and producers, died yesterday at noon in Doctors Hospital, East End Avenue and Eighty-seventh Street, after an illness of eight months.
docs.lead_paragraph: Harry L. Reichenbach, press agent for motion picture stars and producers, died yesterday at noon in Doctors Hospital, East End Avenue and Eighty-seventh Street, after an illness of eight months.

headline.main: H.L. REICHENBACH, PRESS AGENT, DEAD; Was Noted for His Original and Successful Accomplishments in the Publicity Field. SCREEN STARS HIS CLIENTS Took Obscure Painting and Gave It World-Wide Note as "September Morn"--Funeral on Monday. Also With P.T. Barnum. "Virgin of Stamboul" Stunt.
